type.description: type of the field, see `FieldType` for possible values

required.description: if required=True, the field is required in the input data
required.title: Required

input_field.description: name of the input field to use when importing data
input_field.title: Input Field

split.description: do we split the input field with `split_separator`
split.title: Split

include_multi_match.description: do we include the field in the multi-match query used as baseline results
include_multi_match.title: Include Multi Match

name.description: name of the index alias to use
name.title: Name

id_field_name.description: name of the field to use for `_id`
id_field_name.title: Id Field Name

last_modified_field_name.description: name of the field containing the date of last modification, used for incremental updates using Redis queues. The field value must be an int/float representing the timestamp.
last_modified_field_name.title: Last Modified Field Name

number_of_shards.description: number of shards to use for the index
number_of_shards.title: Number Of Shards

number_of_replicas.description: number of replicas to use for the index
number_of_replicas.title: Number Of Replicas

exported_langs.description: a list of languages for which we want taxonomized fields to be always exported during indexing. During indexing, we use the taxonomy to translate every taxonomized field in a language-specific subfield. The list of language depends on the value defined here and on the optional `taxonomy_langs` field that can be defined in each document.
exported_langs.title: Exported Langs

url.description: URL of the taxonomy, must be in JSON format and follows Open Food Facts taxonomy format.
url.title: Url

fields.description: configuration of all fields in the index, keys are field names and values contain the field configuration
fields.title: Fields

split_separator.description: separator to use when splitting values, for fields that have split=True
split_separator.title: Split Separator

lang_separator.description: for `text_lang` FieldType, the separator between the name of the field and the language code, ex: product_name_it if lang_separator="_"
lang_separator.title: Lang Separator

anyOf.description: The full qualified reference to the preprocessor to use before data import. This is used to adapt the data schema or to add search-a-licious specific fields for example.
The full qualified reference to the elasticsearch result processor to use after search query to Elasticsearch. This is used to add custom fields for example.

supported_langs.description: A list of all supported languages, it is used to build index mapping
supported_langs.title: Supported Langs

match_phrase_boost.description: How much we boost exact matches on individual fields
match_phrase_boost.title: Match Phrase Boost

document_denylist.description: list of documents IDs to ignore
document_denylist.title: Document Denylist

title: JSON schema for search-a-licious configuration file
